author: chris2_2_2
content: What if node operators in mass get sued for the blocks they create and transactions that occured in them?

author: chris2_2_2
content: Shouldn't the network be protecting its components? (And in this case we have a real world situation we're dealing with that butta likely is too)

author: yorickdowne
content: Not really. There are efforts underway for US operators, and all guidance received will no doubt be shared more widely. So far, OFAC has been purposefully obscure.

author: yorickdowne
content: And that lack of clarity is clarity in and of itself: If the guidance was "you better not include those tx in your blocks", they would have just said so.

author: yorickdowne
content: And yes that'd have been all over the crypto and possibly mainstream news shortly. They didn't say that. They refuse to say either way. Maybe they're waiting for a consensus to emerge that they like.

author: yorickdowne
content: So in the meantime: Keep on trucking.
